instructions.instruction: Colors in your kitchen, press "Next" to play.
Select milk, bath cleaner, water and lemon juice from the cupboard.
Click to pour the lemon juice inside the red cabbage solution.
Red cabbage solution changes its color according to the pH value of the solution.
Click on the pH scale on the left to identify the pH value of the lemon juice.
The pH value of lemon juice is 2. Thus, it is called an acid.
Click to pour the bath cleaner inside the red cabbage solution.
Click on the pH scale on the left to identify the pH value of the bath cleaner.
The pH value of bath cleaner is 13. Thus, it is called an alkali.
Click to pour the water inside the red cabbage solution.
Click on the pH scale on the left to identify the pH value of the water.
The pH value of water is 7. Thus, it is neutral.
Click to pour the milk inside the red cabbage solution.
Click on the pH scale on the left to identify the pH value of the milk.
The pH value of milk is 6. Thus, it is acid.
The pH of lemon juice is lower than the pH of milk, therefore lemon juice is the stronger acid
instructions.effect: show next phase should be activated

instructions.instruction: It's time to identify the pH of all the substances on the table. Click on one of them to select it.
Now identify its pH. You can also compare it to other substances by clicking on them.
